availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Solomon W. Lake (Brown County, IL, cooper and soldier 14th IL inf.)

body.p: Brown County, Illinois, cooper and soldier. Illinois native. Son of Johnson Lake and Mary Lake. Married to Roseanna Lake. Father of Lucretia Lake, Samuel J. Lake, and Mary Lake. Resident of Henderson County, Illinois, in 1850. Cooper in Cooperstown in 1860. Served in the 14th Illinois Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Henderson County, Township 9N5W, p. 86A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Brown County, Cooperstown, p. 737.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Brown County, Cooperstown, p. 17A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Illinois, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M539, Roll 0051.
"Solomon Wickum Lake (1835-1926)," Find A Grave, Memorial #107025454, accessed August 19, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107025454.
